derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English swimman (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zwemmen and German schwimmen

encyclopedia.content: swim KK: [swim] DJ: [swim] vi. 1. 游，游泳 A horse can swim. 马会游泳。 2. 浮，漂浮；滑行 3. 浸，泡[(+in/with)] 4. 充溢，充满[(+with)] Her eyes were swimming with tears. 她泪水盈眶。 5. 旋转，摇晃；眼花，晕眩 I was tired out, and my head was swimming. 我累坏了，头发晕。 vt. 1. 游过；与。..赛游泳 She tried to swim the English Channel. 她试图横渡英吉利海峡。 2. 使锛埪淼蕊級游水 3. 使浮起 n. 1. 游泳

entry.def: When you swim, you move through water by making movements with your arms and legs.

example.ex: She learned to swim when she was really tiny...
example.tran: 她很小的时候就学会了游泳。

example.ex: I went round to Jonathan's to see if he wanted to go swimming...
example.tran: 我去乔纳森那里看看他是否想去游泳。

entry.def: If you swim a race, you take part in a swimming race.

example.ex: She swam the 400 metres medley ten seconds slower than she did in 1980.
example.tran: 她 400 米混合泳的成绩比其 1980 年慢了 10 秒。

entry.def: If you swim a stretch of water, you keep swimming until you have crossed it.

example.ex: In 1875, Captain Matthew Webb became the first man to swim the English Channel.
example.tran: 1875年，马修·韦布船长成为横渡英吉利海峡的第一人。

entry.def: When a fish swims, it moves through water by moving its body.

example.ex: The barriers are lethal to fish trying to swim upstream.
example.tran: 这些障碍物对于想要往上游游动的鱼儿来说是致命的。

entry.tran: (通常指生病时觉得物体仿佛在)旋转，摇晃
entry.def: If objects swim, they seem to be moving backwards and forwards, usually because you are ill.

example.ex: Alexis suddenly could take no more: he felt too hot, he couldn't breathe, the room swam.
example.tran: 亚历克西斯突然觉得受不了了，他感到闷热，喘不上气，仿佛整间屋子在旋转。

entry.def: If your head is swimming, you feel unsteady and slightly ill.

example.ex: The musty aroma of incense made her head swim.
example.tran: 熏香发霉的气味令她感到头晕。

entry.def: If something is swimming in liquid or is swimming with liquid, it is surrounded by and covered with it.

example.ex: He polished off a large steak, salad, broccoli swimming in thick sauce, and half a litre of wine.
example.tran: 他狼吞虎咽地吃下了一大块牛排、很多色拉和浸着浓稠酱汁的花耶菜，还喝了半升红酒。

sentences.sentence: "We had to swim for 20 minutes to reach the shore"
"a big fish was swimming in the tank"

means.word_mean: 2. be afloat; stay on a liquid surface; not sink

sentences.en: He has swum the English Channel three times.
sentences.cn: 他已三次游过英吉利海峡。

sentences.en: He was hot and tired and his head was swimming.
sentences.cn: 他又热又累, 头晕目眩。

sentences.en: He goes for a swim every morning.

jushi.chinese: 我还是孩子时就学会了游泳。
